action.action-desc: Mr. Grassley (for himself and Ms. Hassan) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To expand the sharing of information with respect to suspected violations of intellectual property rights in trade.

section.header: Sharing of information with respect to suspected violations of intellectual property rights
section.text: Section 628A of the Tariff Act of 1930 (19 U.S.C. 1628a) is amended—

subparagraph.text: in the matter preceding paragraph (1), by striking suspects and inserting has a reasonable suspicion;

clause.text: by inserting , packing materials, shipping containers, after its packaging each place it appears; and
by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (2), by striking the period and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: may provide to the person nonpublic information about the merchandise that was—

subparagraph.text: generated by an online marketplace or other similar market platform, an express consignment operator, a freight forwarder, or any other entity that plays a role in the sale or importation of merchandise into the United States or the facilitation of such sale or importation; and
provided to, shared with, or obtained by, U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
in paragraph (3), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in paragraph (4), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: any other party with an interest in the merchandise, as determined appropriate by the Commissioner.
